articles.description: The UCLA Bruins extended the contract of coach Chip Kelly through 2025 on Friday, a day before his initial deal was set to expire.
articles.headline: UCLA Bruins, Chip Kelly agree to four-year extension through 2025

images.name: Zach Charbonnet  [600x400]
images.caption: Zach Charbonnet and the UCLA running game averaged 7.3 yards per carry against LSU in their season-opening win.

articles.description: UCLA's Zach Charbonnet will return for the 2022 season after leading the Bruins with 1,137 rushing yards and 13 touchdowns on 202 carries.
articles.headline: UCLA's Zach Charbonnet announces he'll return for 2022 season

images.name: Pittman says Hogs will have fun celebrating success
images.caption: Arkansas' Sam Pittman joins The Paul Finebaum Show to discuss the importance of celebrating the Razorbacks' success and how they need to enjoy every moment.

articles.description: Arkansas' Sam Pittman joins The Paul Finebaum Show to discuss the importance of celebrating the Razorbacks' success and how they need to enjoy every moment.
articles.headline: Pittman says Hogs will have fun celebrating success

images.name: Kirk Ferentz [1296x864]
images.caption: Iowa coach Kirk Ferentz said Thursday that the Hawkeyes will have to adapt after four players left school early to enter the NFL draft. Tight end was hard hit as both T.J. Hockenson and Noah Fant declared themselves eligible for the draft.

images.name: Wildcats rally past Hawkeyes in Citrus Bowl
images.caption: After falling behind in the fourth quarter, No. 22 Kentucky scores with less than two minutes to play and holds on to beat No. 15 Iowa, 20-17.

articles.description: Kirk Ferentz, the all-time winningest football coach at Iowa who is coming off his 23rd season at the school, has agreed to a contract extension though 2029 that is worth $7 million annually.
articles.headline: Iowa Hawkeyes, football coach Kirk Ferentz agree to extension through 2029 season

articles.description: After winning the College Football Playoff National Championship on Monday, Georgia QB Stetson Bennett took his talents to a local Raising Cane's drive-thru to serve meals to customers.
articles.headline: Georgia Bulldogs QB Stetson Bennett surprises customers at Raising Cane's Chicken restaurant

images.name: UGA's Bennett says 'you work for things like this'
images.caption: QB Stetson Bennett credits Georgia's defense for keeping them in the national championship after offensive mistakes and explains why he "bet" on himself.

images.name: Slade Bolden soars over a defender for an Alabama score
images.caption: Bryce Young dumps one off to Slade Bolden, who takes flight for another Alabama touchdown.

articles.description: Alabama receivers Slade Bolden and John Metchie III will enter the NFL draft, while linebacker Henry To'oTo'o, defensive lineman DJ Dale, safeties DeMarcco Hellams and Jordan Battle and offensive guard Emil Ekiyor Jr. will return for their senior years.
articles.headline: Alabama Crimson Tide receivers Slade Bolden, John Metchie III to enter NFL draft; four defensive starters to return

article.description: Kent State and Illinois postponed their season-opening game until Saturday after a lightning delay of almost three hours on Friday night.
article.headline: Kent State-Illinois bumped to Saturday after long lightning delay
article.linkText: Kent State-Illinois moved to Sat. after lightning
article.story:
CHAMPAIGN, Ill. -- Kent State and Illinois postponed their season-opening game until Saturday after a lightning delay of almost three hours on Friday night.

The school's athletic directors decided to push the game back to a 1 p.m. Central time kickoff. Illinois sports information director Kent Brown said it will not be televised.

Brown said tickets to Friday's game will be honored Saturday.

The lightning rolled into the Champaign area around 7:30 p.m. Kickoff was scheduled for just after 8 p.m.

Many fans waited in the concourses of Memorial Stadium through the delay.

Kent State sports information director Aaron Chimenti said the Golden Flashes were looking late Friday for hotel rooms for a party of about 145 people. He estimated the cost of the extra night at about $8,000, not including meals.
